message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NI 

The paper focuses on the neural mechanisms involved in visual perception, specifically in the context of geometrical illusions. It uses computational models to simulate the processing of retinal ganglion cells and their interaction with multiscale visual processing. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the use of neural models and simulations suggests that it could also belong to the neural networks (cs.NE) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the potential for the model to reveal underlying mechanisms connecting low-level filtering approaches to mid- and high-level explanations, which suggests that it could also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on the visual system and its processing suggests that it could also belong to the neuroinformatics (cs.NI) sub-category.
